004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Pair;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.GenericHID;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
011import java.util.HashMap;
012import java.util.Map;
013
014/**
015 * A version of {@link GenericHID} with {@link Trigger} factories for command-based.
016 *
017 * @see GenericHID
018 */
019public class CommandGenericHID {
020  private final GenericHID m_hid;
021  private final Map<EventLoop, Map<Integer, Trigger>> m_buttonCache = new HashMap<>();
022  private final Map<EventLoop, Map<Pair<Integer, Double>, Trigger>> m_axisLessThanCache =
023      new HashMap<>();
024  private final Map<EventLoop, Map<Pair<Integer, Double>, Trigger>> m_axisGreaterThanCache =
025      new HashMap<>();
026  private final Map<EventLoop, Map<Integer, Trigger>> m_povCache = new HashMap<>();
027
028  /**
029   * Construct an instance of a device.
030   *
031   * @param port The port index on the Driver Station that the device is plugged into.
032   */
033  public CommandGenericHID(int port) {
034    m_hid = new GenericHID(port);
035  }
036
037  /**
038   * Get the underlying GenericHID object.
039   *
040   * @return the wrapped GenericHID object
041   */
042  public GenericHID getHID() {
043    return m_hid;
044  }
045
046  /**
047   * Constructs an event instance around this button's digital signal.
048   *
049   * @param button the button index
050   * @return an event instance representing the button's digital signal attached to the {@link
051   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
052   * @see #button(int, EventLoop)
053   */
054  public Trigger button(int button) {
055    return button(button, CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Constructs an event instance around this button's digital signal.
060   *
061   * @param button the button index
062   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
063   * @return an event instance representing the button's digital signal attached to the given loop.
064   */
065  public Trigger button(int button, EventLoop loop) {
066    var cache = m_buttonCache.computeIfAbsent(loop, k -> new HashMap<>());
067    return cache.computeIfAbsent(button, k -> new Trigger(loop, () -> m_hid.getRawButton(k)));
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around this angle of the default (index 0) POV on the HID,
072   * attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default command scheduler button
073   * loop}.
074   *
075   * <p>The POV angles start at 0 in the up direction, and increase clockwise (e.g. right is 90,
076   * upper-left is 315).
077   *
078   * @param angle POV angle in degrees, or -1 for the center / not pressed.
079   * @return a Trigger instance based around this angle of a POV on the HID.
080   */
081  public Trigger pov(int angle) {
082    return pov(0, angle, CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around this angle of a POV on the HID.
087   *
088   * <p>The POV angles start at 0 in the up direction, and increase clockwise (e.g. right is 90,
089   * upper-left is 315).
090   *
091   * @param pov index of the POV to read (starting at 0). Defaults to 0.
092   * @param angle POV angle in degrees, or -1 for the center / not pressed.
093   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to. Defaults to {@link
094   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default command scheduler button loop}.
095   * @return a Trigger instance based around this angle of a POV on the HID.
096   */
097  public Trigger pov(int pov, int angle, EventLoop loop) {
098    var cache = m_povCache.computeIfAbsent(loop, k -> new HashMap<>());
099    // angle can be -1, so use 3600 instead of 360
100    return cache.computeIfAbsent(
101        pov * 3600 + angle, k -> new Trigger(loop, () -> m_hid.getPOV(pov) == angle));
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around the 0 degree angle (up) of the default (index 0) POV
106   * on the HID, attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default command
107   * scheduler button loop}.
108   *
109   * @return a Trigger instance based around the 0 degree angle of a POV on the HID.
110   */
111  public Trigger povUp() {
112    return pov(0);
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around the 45 degree angle (right up) of the default (index
117   * 0) POV on the HID, attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default
118   * command scheduler button loop}.
119   *
120   * @return a Trigger instance based around the 45 degree angle of a POV on the HID.
121   */
122  public Trigger povUpRight() {
123    return pov(45);
124  }
125
126  /**
127   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around the 90 degree angle (right) of the default (index 0)
128   * POV on the HID, attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default command
129   * scheduler button loop}.
130   *
131   * @return a Trigger instance based around the 90 degree angle of a POV on the HID.
132   */
133  public Trigger povRight() {
134    return pov(90);
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around the 135 degree angle (right down) of the default
139   * (index 0) POV on the HID, attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the
140   * default command scheduler button loop}.
141   *
142   * @return a Trigger instance based around the 135 degree angle of a POV on the HID.
143   */
144  public Trigger povDownRight() {
145    return pov(135);
146  }
147
148  /**
149   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around the 180 degree angle (down) of the default (index 0)
150   * POV on the HID, attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default command
151   * scheduler button loop}.
152   *
153   * @return a Trigger instance based around the 180 degree angle of a POV on the HID.
154   */
155  public Trigger povDown() {
156    return pov(180);
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around the 225 degree angle (down left) of the default
161   * (index 0) POV on the HID, attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the
162   * default command scheduler button loop}.
163   *
164   * @return a Trigger instance based around the 225 degree angle of a POV on the HID.
165   */
166  public Trigger povDownLeft() {
167    return pov(225);
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around the 270 degree angle (left) of the default (index 0)
172   * POV on the HID, attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default command
173   * scheduler button loop}.
174   *
175   * @return a Trigger instance based around the 270 degree angle of a POV on the HID.
176   */
177  public Trigger povLeft() {
178    return pov(270);
179  }
180
181  /**
182   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around the 315 degree angle (left up) of the default (index
183   * 0) POV on the HID, attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default
184   * command scheduler button loop}.
185   *
186   * @return a Trigger instance based around the 315 degree angle of a POV on the HID.
187   */
188  public Trigger povUpLeft() {
189    return pov(315);
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Constructs a Trigger instance based around the center (not pressed) position of the default
194   * (index 0) POV on the HID, attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the
195   * default command scheduler button loop}.
196   *
197   * @return a Trigger instance based around the center position of a POV on the HID.
198   */
199  public Trigger povCenter() {
200    return pov(-1);
201  }
202
203  /**
204   * Constructs a Trigger instance that is true when the axis value is less than {@code threshold},
205   * attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default command scheduler button
206   * loop}.
207   *
208   * @param axis The axis to read, starting at 0
209   * @param threshold The value below which this trigger should return true.
210   * @return a Trigger instance that is true when the axis value is less than the provided
211   *     threshold.
212   */
213  public Trigger axisLessThan(int axis, double threshold) {
214    return axisLessThan(axis, threshold, CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
215  }
216
217  /**
218   * Constructs a Trigger instance that is true when the axis value is less than {@code threshold},
219   * attached to the given loop.
220   *
221   * @param axis The axis to read, starting at 0
222   * @param threshold The value below which this trigger should return true.
223   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the trigger to
224   * @return a Trigger instance that is true when the axis value is less than the provided
225   *     threshold.
226   */
227  public Trigger axisLessThan(int axis, double threshold, EventLoop loop) {
228    var cache = m_axisLessThanCache.computeIfAbsent(loop, k -> new HashMap<>());
229    return cache.computeIfAbsent(
230        Pair.of(axis, threshold), k -> new Trigger(loop, () -> getRawAxis(axis) < threshold));
231  }
232
233  /**
234   * Constructs a Trigger instance that is true when the axis value is less than {@code threshold},
235   * attached to {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() the default command scheduler button
236   * loop}.
237   *
238   * @param axis The axis to read, starting at 0
239   * @param threshold The value above which this trigger should return true.
240   * @return a Trigger instance that is true when the axis value is greater than the provided
241   *     threshold.
242   */
243  public Trigger axisGreaterThan(int axis, double threshold) {
244    return axisGreaterThan(axis, threshold, CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
245  }
246
247  /**
248   * Constructs a Trigger instance that is true when the axis value is greater than {@code
249   * threshold}, attached to the given loop.
250   *
251   * @param axis The axis to read, starting at 0
252   * @param threshold The value above which this trigger should return true.
253   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the trigger to.
254   * @return a Trigger instance that is true when the axis value is greater than the provided
255   *     threshold.
256   */
257  public Trigger axisGreaterThan(int axis, double threshold, EventLoop loop) {
258    var cache = m_axisGreaterThanCache.computeIfAbsent(loop, k -> new HashMap<>());
259    return cache.computeIfAbsent(
260        Pair.of(axis, threshold), k -> new Trigger(loop, () -> getRawAxis(axis) > threshold));
261  }
262
263  /**
264   * Get the value of the axis.
265   *
266   * @param axis The axis to read, starting at 0.
267   * @return The value of the axis.
268   */
269  public double getRawAxis(int axis) {
270    return m_hid.getRawAxis(axis);
271  }
272
273  /**
274   * Set the rumble output for the HID. The DS currently supports 2 rumble values, left rumble and
275   * right rumble.
276   *
277   * @param type Which rumble value to set
278   * @param value The normalized value (0 to 1) to set the rumble to
279   */
280  public void setRumble(GenericHID.RumbleType type, double value) {
281    m_hid.setRumble(type, value);
282  }
283
284  /**
285   * Get if the HID is connected.
286   *
287   * @return true if the HID is connected
288   */
289  public boolean isConnected() {
290    return m_hid.isConnected();
291  }
292}
